content:
• Wednesday, January 10, 2018
  • XRX

    WSJ: Xerox in major deal talks with Fujifilm; XRX +3.8%

    • Xerox (NYSE:XRX) is in talks with Fujifilm (OTCPK:FUJIY) for a potentially major deal, The Wall Street Journal reports, that could result in change of control at the company.
    • Xerox shares are up 3.8% after hours.
    • But while an array of possible deals are on the table, it wouldn't be a full takeover of Xerox, according to the report.
    • The two are already joint venture partners, and a deal isn't imminent, the WSJ says.
    • Xerox's market cap is about $7.7B and the company has more than $4B in net debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM | 8 Comments
  • NTCT

    NetScout slides 14% after cutting FY forecast in early results

    • NetScout (NASDAQ:NTCT) took a fall today, -13.6%, after issuing preliminary results for its fiscal Q3 and cut its forecast for fiscal 2018 below analyst estimates.
    • It's now expecting GAAP revenue for fiscal 2018 of $985M-$1.015B; it had previously forecast low single-digit growth from last year's $1.162B. Non-GAAP revenue is expected at $1B-$1.025B, below consensus for $1.077B.
    • It also said it's executing an accelerated share repurchase -- buying at least $250M of common stock, funded by additional debt -- and will increase its credit facility from $800M to $1B, with potential to increase it further on closing. That will set the final amount of the ASR, which could hit $300M.
    • Taking that all into account, NetScout expects non-GAAP EPS of $1.30-$1.45, well below consensus for $1.83.
    • It will formally report Q3 results on Jan. 30 before the market opens, and hold a conference call at 8:30 a.m. ET that day.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 PM
  • Z

    Zillow +1.8% as Morgan Stanley sees entry point and boosts to Buy

    • Zillow Group (NASDAQ:Z) has risen 1.8% after hours following an upgrade to Overweight at Morgan Stanley.
    • The firm sees a good entry point for a "category winner" with strong moats, after relative underperformance last year (shares rose just 12% in 2017).
    • The stock is trading at 25 times 2018 EBITDA, analyst Jonathan Lanterman notes -- a historic low (excepting the market sell-off of January 2016) and a 16% discount to its two-year average. (h/t Bloomberg)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers (1/10/2018)

    • Top gainers: PRGS +7.6%. NVAX +4.7%. MFIN +4.3%. KBH +3.8%. STKL +3.1%.
    • Top losers: BK -1.8%. CEIX -1.4%. AKAO -1.4%. SSW -1.3%. WLL -1.2%.

  • PRGS

    Progress Software +8.2% after Q4 beats, in-line and above guidance

    • Progress Software (NASDAQ:PRGS) shares are up 8.2% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates and included in-line and above guidance.
    • Q1 guidance: revenue, $90M to $93M (consensus: $91.95M); EPS, $0.46 to $0.48 (consensus: $0.38). 
    • FY18 guidance: revenue, $399M to $404M (consensus: $400.69M); EPS, $2.29 to $2.35 (consensus: $1.91). 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Progress Software beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • KBH

    KB Home up nearly 3% after earnings beat

    • FQ4 (ended Nov. 30) income of $84.3M or $0.84 per share vs. $37.5M and $0.40 a year ago.
    • Deliveries up 9% Y/Y to 3,340 homes.
    • Average selling price up 8% to $416.5K.
    • Net order value up 9% to $935.4M, up 2% in units to 2,296.
    • Backlog order value up 9% to $1.66B, flat in units at 4,411.
    • Excluding inventory-related charges, housing gross profit margin up 160 basis points to 18.6%; operating income margin up 220 bps to 9.9%.
    • Conference call at 5 ET
    • Previously: KB Home beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Jan. 10)
    • KBH +2.9% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 12 Comments
  • COUP

    Coupa Software -1.4% on senior note offering

    • Coupa Software (NASDAQ:COUP) will offer $200M in convertible senior notes due 2023.
    • Coupa intends to grant initial purchasers the option of buying up to $30M aggregate principal amount of the notes.
    • The company will use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes, potential acquisitions, strategic transactions, and paying off capped call transactions.
    • Coupa shares are down 1.4% aftermarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 3 Comments
  • KBH

    KB Home beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • KB Home (NYSE:KBH): Q4 EPS of $0.84 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $1.4B (+17.6% Y/Y) beats by $40M.
    • Shares +3.5%.
    • Press Release

  • LEDS

    SemiLEDs reports Q1 results

    • SemiLEDs (NASDAQ:LEDS): Q1 EPS of -$0.11
    • Revenue of $2M (-22.2% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.2%.

  • QCOM

    Qualcomm unveils severance plan to protect employees from Broadcom

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) unveils a severance plan that would cover most employees if Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) acquired the company and started cutting jobs.
    • The severance applies to workers fired without cause or those leaving for “good reason” such as salary reduction or a relocation. 
    • The wording also covers “change of control” due to an acquisition or a change to the majority of the board. 
    • Background: Broadcom made an unsolicited $70 per share offer for Qualcomm on November 6. Qualcomm insiders are rumored to want above $80 per share to consider the offer. Broadcom nominated a slate of directors to replace the current Qualcomm board and shareholders will vote on the matter at the annual meeting in March. 
    • Qualcomm shares are up 0.1%. 
    • Broadcom shares are down 2.2%.    
    • Previously: WSJ: Potential Broadcom, Qualcomm merger worries Chinese smartphone makers (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM | 91 Comments
  • FOX

    Fox nears deal to buy 10 Sinclair stations

    • With a Disney deal set to relieve it of numerous media assets and provide for a refocus on news and broadcasting, Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX -2.4%, FOXA -2.7%) is in final talks to buy about 10 local stations from local-broadcast giant Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +8.7%).
    • That in turn will help Sinclair please regulators who need to approve its $4B takeover of Tribune Media (TRCO +2.7%). Fox's deal would be contingent on that acquisition being successful.
    • Fox is looking to buy stations in markets where Sinclair would end up with two full-power stations in its deal, including Denver and Seattle.
    • The deal would boost Fox's local-TV ownership footprint by more than a third; it currently owns 28 channels in 17 markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 5 Comments
  • LPCN

    Ad Com thumbs down on Lipocine's Tlando

    • The FDA's Bone, Reproductive and Urologic Drugs Advisory Committee voted 13-6 that the benefits of Lipocine's (NASDAQ:LPCN) oral testosterone replacement med TLANDO (testosterone undecanoate) do not outweigh the risks.
    • Trading has been suspended all day. Nasdaq has not posted a resumption time.
    • A final decision from the FDA will be announced no later than May 8.
    • Previously: Ad Comm review approaches for Lipocine's oral testosterone replacement med Tlando; shares ahead 17% (Jan. 8)
    • Update: Shares will resume trading at 4:50 pm ET.
    • Update: Shares are down 56% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 9 Comments

  • KSU

    Railroad sector jittery after U.S. NAFTA exit report

    • Railroad stocks go into reverse after a Reuters exclusive indicates that Canada is convinced that the U.S. is poised to announce an exit from NAFTA.
    • On watch: Kansas City Southern (KSU -3.1%), Canadian Pacific (CP -2.7%), Canadian National Railway (CNI -2.4%), CSX (CSX -1.5%) and Norfolk Southern (NSC -1.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 74 Comments
  • CJREF

    Corus Entertainment -15.7% as TV ads weigh on earnings

    • Corus Entertainment (OTCPK:CJREF) has tumbled 15.7% in OTC trading after posting Q1 earnings where it missed lowest estimates.
    • Ad revenues fell 4% in TV and 1% in radio, and profits in the TV segment fell 9%. Radio, meanwhile, saw its profit bump up 2%.
    • Overall, revenues fell 2% and consolidated segment profit was down 7%. Net income rose to C$77.7M from a year-ago C$71.1M.
    • "Our first quarter results were below expectations, as gains in local Radio advertising and our Nelvana content business combined with better than expected subscriber revenues were more than offset by weak television advertising market conditions," says CEO Doug Murphy.
    • Revenue by segment: Television, C$415.5M (down 2%); Radio, C$41.9M (flat).
    • Free cash flow increased to C$83.2M from a year-ago C$33.9M.
    • Earnings slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 18 Comments
  • GPRK

    GeoPark posts strong gains in 2017, Q4 production

    • GeoPark (GPRK +5%) is higher after reporting a 23% Y/Y increase in 2017 production to 27,586 boe/day, beating internal guidance expecting 26.5K-27.5K, with record year-end exit production of 31,977 boe/day.
    • For Q4, GPRK says consolidated oil and gas production rose 30% Y/Y and 8% Q/Q to 30,654 boe/day, as oil production increased 35% Y/Y and 9% Q/Q to 25,341 bbl/day and gas production climbed 11% Y/Y and 4% Q/Q to 31.9M cf/day.
    • GPRK also says it is expecting to drill more than 30 wells during 2018 with production rising another 15%-20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • KSS

    Kohl's plans on leasing space to retailers

    • Kohl's (KSS +3.3%) is looking at partnering with retailers to lease extra space in its stores, according to CNBC.
    • CEO Kevin Mansell said on the sidelines of the ICR Conference that the department store operator plans to work out deals with grocery store chains or convenience stores in a bid to boost traffic.
    • #ICR18
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 13 Comments
  • SSNC

    Reuters: SS&C could acquire DST Systems; DST +21%

    • SS&C Technologies (NASDAQ:SSNC) is in advanced talks to acquire DST Systems (NYSE:DST) for around $84 per share, according to Reuters sources.
    • The all-cash deal could be announced as early as next week.
    • DST shares are up 21%. 
    • SS&C shares are up 12%.       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • TRCO

    Sinclair, ABC renew affiliation deals to 2022

    • ABC TV (DIS -0.3%) and Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +6.7%), the nation's biggest owner of local stations, have set a multi-year deal extending affiliations across all Sinclair stations to August 2022.
    • That includes affiliation deals that had been set to expire by the end of 2017, as well as ABC affiliates where Sinclair provides services under a joint sales agreement.
    • And the two have agreed to include affiliation deals with Tribune Media (NYSE:TRCO) contingent on the closing of Sinclair's acquisition of Tribune.
    • Sinclair's 34 ABC affiliates across 30 markets serve 16M households, covering 14% of the United States.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 2 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: LGCY +12%. HOS +9%. EMES +9%. PAH-OLD +7%. ICD +7%.
    • Losers: KLDX -11%. DELT -8%. MCEP -8%. TAT -7%. CGG-OLD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • DIS

    Dish CEO raises concerns over media/telecom megamergers

    • Dish Network (DISH -0.8%) is speaking out against telecom/media megamergers again.
    • "What we have publicly said is we have concerns with AT&T (T -1.6%) and Time Warner (TWX -0.7%)," Dish CEO Erik Carlson tells CNBC. Carlson's picking up the mantle of former CEO Charlie Ergen, who handed the reins to Carlson in December so that he could focus on an emerging wireless business.
    • Deals like AT&T's, and Disney's (NYSE:DIS) deal to buy media assets from Fox (FOX -1.2%, FOXA -1.5%), could severely constrain content and raise prices, Carlson says, arguing Dish is thinking "about the customer and the customer first."
    • Dish has objected to a number of mergers in the industry in recent years, including Charter/Time Warner Cable, and Nexstar/Media General.
    • Meanwhile, Dish Network itself has been the subject of heavy M&A speculation over the years, in part due to its wireless spectrum hoard (leading many to think a combination with Sprint or T-Mobile is likely).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 34 Comments
  • RF

    Big day for financials as rates break out

    • The major average are modestly lower, but the broad financial sector (XLF +1.2%) - led by the banks (KRE +2.4%), (KBE +2.4%) - is sharply higher as the bond bear market gains steam.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield rose as up to 2.60% earlier today - the highest rate since just after the 2016 presidential election. This came as the two-year yield held essentially flat, meaning a widening yield curve, and boosted margins for lenders.
    • Strongest among the banks today are the regional players: Regions Financial (RF +2.6%), New York Community (NYCB +5.2%), KeyCorp (KEY +2.5%), BB&T (BBT +2.3%), BofI Holdings (BOFI +4.1%), Huntington Bancshares (HBAN +2.8%).
    • Life insurers: MetLife (MET +2.5%), Prudential (PRU +3.1%). Too big to fails: Bank of America (BAC +1.4%), Morgan Stanley (MS +2.2%), Wells Fargo (WFC +1.8%).
    • ETFs: XLF, FAS, FAZ, KRE, VFH, KBE, UYG, FNCL, IYF, BTO, IAT, IYG, KBWB, RYF, QABA, KBWR, FXO, SEF, FINU, DPST, RWW, FINZ, WDRW, JHMF, FAZZ, FTXO, FNCF
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM | 38 Comments
  • SPOT

    CFO: Sirius XM to focus on internal value rather than M&A

    • Sirius XM (SIRI +2.9%) is going to focus on creating internal value rather than pursuing any major merger/acquisition activity, its chief financial officer says.
    • Speaking at Citi's Global TMT West Conference, David Frear said "Our organic growth opportunities are still massive," warning that major acquisitions might not be the most efficient way to grow and might even risk focus.
    • "You can pursue the ego-gratifying strategic initiatives, and take all of managements' attention and focus on what has been acquired," he said. "Then you take your eye off of the part of the business that creates all the value."
    • Terrestrial radio, not Spotify (MUSIC), is Sirius' real competitor, he says, but rather than buy a terrestrial operator, "We're just a cash-flow machine. We look at ways to deploy the capital and grow the business, first through organic investments."
    • Previously: SiriusXM higher after posting guidance update (Jan. 10 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • SSYS

    IDC: 3D printing will total $12B in 2018

    • Global spending on 3D printing will total nearly $12B in 2018, up 20% on the year, according to IDC.
    • Worldwide spending should reach nearly $20B by 2021 with a five-year CAGR of 20.5%. 
    • 3D printers and materials will account for about two-thirds of the market or $6.9B in CY18 and $6.7B in CY21. Services spending will hit $5.5B in CY21. 
    • Top markets: Discrete manufacturing, healthcare, education, and consumer. 
    • Relevant stocks: Stratasys (SSYS +0.1%), 3D Systems (DDD +0.7%), Materialise (MTLS +4.8%).  
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 16 Comments
  • BLKCF

    Global Blockchain lead investor in Kodak ICO

    • Global Blockchain Technologies (OTCPK:BLKCF) is up 31% amid a report from Reuters that the company is the lead investor on Kodak's KODK pre-ICO.
    • Reuters says Global Blockchain is subscribed for all 8M KODAKCoins available in the offering.
    • Previously: Kodak rockets higher again (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 13 Comments

  • AFSI

    AmTrust up 27%, and through proposed buyout price

    • AmTrust (NASDAQ:AFSI) has formed a special committee of the board to study the $12.25 per share buyout proposal by the Karfunkel-Zyskind family.
    • Shares are up 26.75% to $12.86.
    • Judging by the comment stream on first news of the bid and a stock price that was nearly $28 last February, and spent almost all of 2017 above $15, investors have clear concerns that Zyskind and associates are underpaying.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 24 Comments
  • AAWW

    Atlas Air rallies after Cowen upgrade

    • Shares of Atlas Air (NASDAQ:AAWW) ride an upgrade from Cowen to a 6.63% gain.
    • Analyst Helane Becker thinks the company is "well-positioned" to see revenue growth this year.
    • She notes the company is fulfilling its commitment to provide Amazon with 20 aircraft and is looking for additional customers for its larger jets.
    • Atlas Air is moved to an Outperform rating and given a price target of $72.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • NVAX

    Novavax up 44% on positive expectations from late-stage study of RSV vaccine in newborns via maternal immunization

    • Novavax (NVAX +44.4%) is up on almost 5x higher volume on the heels of its announcement of encouraging developments in a Phase 3 clinical trial assessing the effectiveness of its RSV F vaccine in newborns by immunizing mothers. The information was part of a corporate presentation delivered at JPM18.
    • The primary endpoint of the study is the incidence of RSV lower respiratory tract infection. In order to inform on further investment in the program, the company conducted an informational analysis based on a target efficacy threshold of at least 40% at day 90. The analysis showed that the observed efficacy should be 45 - 100%. It also concluded that the medically significant secondary endpoints (e.g., hospitalizations, more severe RSV infections) would likely exceed the threshold for vaccine efficacy.
    • A Data Safety Monitoring Board statistician communicated to the company that the vaccine successfully met these criteria based in an analysis of unblinded data (company remains blinded).
    • Enrollment efforts have been ramped up in order to accelerate the timing of the interim data readout, expected by Q4 2018/Q1 2019. If positive, a U.S. marketing application could be filed by late 2019. If approved, it will be the only game in town. Management sees global peak sales of at least $1.5B ($750M in U.S.).
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 39 Comments
  • LM

    Legg Mason lower by more than 2% after downgrade

    • Analyst Daniel Fannon rings the register on Legg Mason (LM -2.3%) after its 35% run higher over the past year.
    • Noting a negative mix shift for AUM, deteriorating equity performance at ClearBridge, and pressure on margin expansion, he downgrades to Hold from Buy.
    • Ahead of Q4 earnings results, he's partial to Affiliated Managers (AMG -1.6%) and T. Rowe Price (TROW +0.5%) instead.
    • Source: Bloomberg's Brad Olesen
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    | 12:38 PM | 14 Comments
  • AAOI

    Applied Opto -2.3% as B. Riley cautions on sector pricing

    • Applied Optoelectronics (NASDAQ:AAOI) is 2.3% lower, moving down for the second straight day after a cautious analyst note -- this time from B. Riley FBR, launching coverage at Neutral.
    • The pricing environment has "deteriorated significantly" in recent months due to competition, analyst Dave Kang says. Rosenblatt pointed to Chinese competition as a negative for the stock in yesterday's report.
    • Kang says Applied Opto faces price challenges especially with 100G QSFP28, which was to be a key growth driver for the company. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Supplies there may have caught up with and even surpassed demand, he writes.
    • The firm has a $38 price target, implying just 9.4% upside from today's lower price.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 48 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: KODK +57%. VOXX +19%. VNCE +11%. FFHL +11%. NBEV +8%.
    • Losers: FTFT -8%. CLXT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • CAA

    Lennar moves higher after results

    • FQ4 (ended Nov. 30) earnings of $309.6M or $1.29 per share missed estimates by $0.19 as the company delayed a transaction from FQ4 to this year in order to take advantage of the new tax reform.
    • FQ4 deliveries of 8,633 homes rose 5% Y/Y; new orders of 7,357 up 12% in units, up 18% in dollar value; backlogs of 8,935 homes up 17% in units, up 23% in dollar value.
    • Gross margin on home sales of 22.4% slips from 23.3%; operating margin of 14% vs. 14.6%.
    • CalAtlantic (NYSE:CAA) purchase is set to close on Feb. 12.
    • Previously: Lennar misses by $0.19, beats on revenue (Jan. 10)
    • LEN +0.75%
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple faces questions from U.S. Senator, class-action lawsuits, and tax reveal

    • U.S. Senator John Thune (R-S.D.) wants Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) to answer questions about its throttling of iPhones with older batteries.
    • The Senate Commerce Committee chairman sent a letter to Apple CEO Tim Cook that was viewed by The Wall Street Journal. 
    • Sen. Thune wants to know how Apple tracked customer complaints about performance issues and whether the company could offer rebates for those who paid full price for a replacement battery before Apple’s apology and $29 battery offer. 
    • More battery woes: Apple now faces 30 class-action lawsuits related to the throttling. 
    • More taxes: FT reports that Apple paid an extra £136M UK tax bill after an audit by HM Revenue & Customs. Ireland was already ordered to collect €13B in back taxes from the tech giant.  
    • The payment was found in Apple Europe accounts with the mention that “this payment of additional tax and interest reflects the company’s increased activity.” 
    • Apple shares are down 0.64%.    
    • Previously: Apple will transfer China cloud business to partner next month; Iovine not leaving Music (Jan. 10)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 45 Comments
  • TEUM

    Pareteum +6.7% on deal with comms provider to Africa

    • Pareteum (NYSEMKT:TEUM), mostly moving lately on word of its latest deal announcements, is up 6.7% after noting it won a three-year contract with a "significant cross-border European and African mobile operator."
    • Pareteum will offer its Global Cloud Services platform and will receive revenue for subscribers, data and messaging services.
    • The company points to Ericsson estimates that cellular Internet-of-Things connections in Africa are expected to grow at a compound annual growth rate of 38% from 2016-2022.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 7 Comments
  • TVTY

    Tivity Health up 5% after JPM18 presentation

    • Tivity Health (TVTY +4.7%) breaks out of consolidation, albeit on low volume. This morning, the company delivered a corporate presentation at JPM18. Key points:
    • Silver Sneakers accounted for ~82% of revenue last year.
    • Growth opportunity in pain management.
    • Updated guidance will be provided in February earnings announcement.
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • FLNT

    Cogint +17.6% on launch of new blockchain service offering

    • Marketing data/analytics firm Cogint (COGT) is up 17.6% after its latest company move: the launch of a Blockchain Solutions division.
    • The company's Red Violet Blockchain and Analytical Solutions unit will offer identify verification and know-your-customer solutions to the burgeoning industry, adding to its service of banking/financial services, insurance, government and law enforcement.
    • Cogint is planning to spin off Red Violet (its unit holding the new blockchain division) as part of its impending business combination with BlueFocus.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 11 Comments
  • EVH

    Evolent Health up 6% on 2018 outlook

    • Evolent Health (EVH +6.1%) is up, albeit on low volume, on the heels of updated 2018 guidance announced by CEO Frank Williams and CFO Nicky McGrane at JPM18.
    • Outlook for this year (slide #20): adjusted services revenue growth: mid-to-high teens; True Health New Mexico adjusted premium revenue: $95M - 100M; adjusted intercompany revenues: $20M.
    • #JPM18
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: BMRA +64%. PAVM +33%. TNDM +17%. GENE +17%. EPZM +14%.
    • Losers: APHB -26%. PTIE -13%. KOOL -9%. AMPE -8%. TRPX -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • HSGX

    Histogenics builds on NeoCart deal-stoked up move, shares ahead 5%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Histogenics (HSGX +4.5%) is up double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 183K shares, on the heels of its announcement that it has received the $10M upfront payment from MEDINET related to the development and commercialization agreement for NeoCart in Japan.
    • Shares have rallied almost 50% since the agreement was announced on December 21, 2017. Histogenics is eligible for up to $87M in milestones and tiered royalties on net sales of NeoCart there.
    • NeoCart is a tissue-engineered implant being developed to treat knee cartilage defects. It is created from the patient's own cartilage cells.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • GBTC

    China ups Bitcoin crackdown

    • According to the WSJ, a multiagency government task force led by the PBOC last week ordered local authorities to "guide" a shutdown of cryptocurrency mining operations.
    • A study by Chainalysis says China accounts for nearly 80% of global Bitcoin mining.
    • While there are some signs local governments are moving to comply with the order, it's hard to imagine the globe quickly losing 80% of its global mining power. China, after all, has been cracking down on crypto for months. "I don’t think miners have been sitting on their hands," says BitMEX's Arthur Hayes. “Some people have already moved their hardware out of China.”
    • OTCQX:GBTC -3.25% today
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 47 Comments

  • EIA Petroleum Inventories

    • EIA Petroleum Inventories: Crude -4.9M barrels vs. -3.9M consensus, -7.4M last week.
    • Gasoline +4.1M barrels vs. +2.6M consensus, +4.8M last week.
    • Distillates +4.3M barrels vs. +1.5M consensus, +8.9M last week.
    • Futures +0.59% to $63.33.
    • ETFs:USO, OIL, UCO, SCO, BNO, DTO, DBO, USL, DNO, SZO, OLO, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 103 Comments

    Hershey slides after Morgan Stanley warns

  • BMRA

    Biomerica's colorectal screening test OK'd in China

    • The China Food and Drug Administration (CFDA) approves Biomerica's (NASDAQ:BMRA) EZ Detect colorectal screening test for the early identification of warning signs associated with colorectal cancer (CRC).
    • EZ Detect is an at-home test that detects fecal (occult) blood, a sign of possible CRC. The EZ Detect pad is tossed into the toilet after a bowel movement. A change in color to blue/green within two minutes indicates the presence of blood in the stool. The pad is then flushed along with the solid waste.
    • The company says ~376K new cases of CRC are reported each year in China.
    • Update: Shares are up 45% in early trading.

    • Affected chipsets include GeForce, Grid, NVS, and Tesla.
    • The company is rolling out patches to fix the problem. 
    • Background: Chip flaws were discovered last week that left working memory data vulnerable to attack on individual devices or shared servers. Initially, it seemed that the patches to fix the problem would have minimal impact on performance, but Microsoft reported yesterday that its patches were rendering some PCs unbootable.

  • AAPL

    Apple will transfer China cloud business to partner next month; Iovine not leaving Music

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will hand its China cloud operations over to a state-owned partner Guizhou-Cloud Big Data Industry Co. on February 28, according to The Wall Street Journal.
    • China law requires companies to store customer data collected in the region locally. 
    • Chinese iCloud customers were notified of the change and had the option to keep using the service or deactivate it by the transfer date. 
    • Background: Last year, Amazon sold its cloud computing equipment to a local partner for similar reasons. Apple has also bent to other Chinese laws and received criticism for removing hundreds of virtual private network apps from the App Store last year.    
    • Beat goes on: Jimmy Iovine isn’t leaving Apple, contrary to a prior Billboard report.
    • Apple shares are down 0.9% premarket.
